title: name and shaming policy is stupid
body:
title.

seriously calling someone/s out because they are trolling rank,even if you have substantial evidence makes you in the wrong is a fucking joke.

lets protect the trolls further then say "we are working to put a stop to this." derp.

replies.body: It's too easy to chop and change a story and tell it in a certain way that makes you look better by making someone else look worse

Holding players accountable for their actions is always a good thing, but vigilante mobs who use anothers bad deeds to justify their own are just going to cause more problems.
Besides you can take things out of context and end up just attacking someone who had a bad day or was being harrassed all game and reacted

The policy is sound

it is very easy to distinguish someone having a bad game and someone who is intently ruining the game.

for instance i played a game last night  were fizz was mid against kayle and got destroyed. the game before that i had a duo who banned two of the champions we picked in load screen, built all boots and ran up mid feeding then saying how there were trying to lose all there placement games

you see the difference? i certainly can.

its not uncommon for players who have been unfairly trash talked all game to get even by trolling their team. Player 1 may have given first blood and had the enemy laner capitalize and snowball through a series of unlucky events, happens alot, then the other players on his team just trash talk him and bully him all game long. Player 1 realizes his whole team is toxic and genuinely doesnt want them to win, he sells his gear, gets boots and proceeds to feed.

at the end of the game, he looks like the only bad party since he fell behind early, got trash talked and received no help all game. His team mates decide to further abuse him by making a forum post about how shit this player was, everyone bitter about feeders jumps on board out of context and proceeds to abuse him, next they add him in game and trash talk him because they feel justified

Does that sound fair?

This is why riot is reluctant to put the power of discipline into the players hands, i know if i was pulled up on the absolute worst parts of my 5 worst games, ever, players would ask for a permaban, and im a really positive player who avoids flaming and blaming and that would be one game in a thousand, it takes a lot for me to get to a point where i will be an asshole on purpose, ALOT!
like 4 players blaming everything on me after i have been ganked non-stop in a lane against a hard counter while having my lanes pushed and CS stolen levels of bullsh!t
There's a slippery slope when it comes to these kinds of rules. I think name and shaming just creates more drama than necessary which can lead to harassment especially of people falsely accused.

Naming and shaming is extremely unnecessary, just send in a ticket to support with the evidence. You are only enforcing a mob mentality or showing how you're some boards hero. If you really care about reporting these players instead of feeding your reputation, then use a ticket.

This policy is fine.

In some ways it's stupid, I totally agree. I like being able to add players to my blacklist, especially if they are known intent feeders or general toxic players.

On the other hand, the boards are brutal. I have had people add me just to tell me to kms because I was bronze and commenting on gameplay and strategy posts. I know that the same kind of people are likely to add these named and shamed "trolls" and give them the same kind of ♥♥♥♥. 

>**Nobody deserves that to be told that **

A lot of players, especially the ones "stuck in elo hell due to their potato teams" name and shame bronze/silver players that are bad and call them trolls and intent feeders. More often than not, they are wrong. People in bronze/silver/gold are usually in their elo for a reason. I mean, if naming and shaming were a thing, I probably would have hundreds of people QQing on the boards about my "intent feeding", when reality is that I just suck.

Naming and shaming would be rife if it were allowed. And in a lot of those cases, false accusations could be made. I think many sites on the internet do not want this situation to happen.
What Riot could do better is have better support ticket options, like better categories. Of course, they want the least amount of reports to come in, because they will save money by not hiring people to deal with them, so this is why the support ticket options are quite vague.

Yes and no.

That is all.
